intro: Justicia glabrata, commonly known as the smooth justicia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are typically smooth and glossy. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of red, orange, or yellow, which are borne on terminal inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. The genus Justicia is known for its showy blooms and is part of the Acanthaceae family.
